Package calculators

Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
calculators.Calculator
Direct Known Subclasses:
CalculatorAdvanced
public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object
The Calculator program implements an application that has ability to do calculations with two numbers. Calculations include: addition (+), subtraction (-), multiplication (*) and division (/). Note:Be careful not to divide number by ZERO, or use non-supported operator!
Since:
2021-11-19
Version:
1.0
Author:
Katarina Antesevic

    • calculate

      public void calculate​(java.lang.Double value, char operator) throws DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException
      Method calculate is method that receives two parameters: value and operator. It allows following operations:addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Based on this statement programmer is allowed to use these chars as second parameter: '+', '-', '*' and '/'.
      Parameters:
      value - This is the first parameter to calculate method. It is Double value.
      operator - This is the second parameter to calculate method. It is char value and it can be one of following chars:'+', '-', '*' and '/'. If programmer chooses some other value of char, NotSupportedOperationException is thrown.
      Throws:
      DivisionByZeroException - This is exception thrown in case that programmer sets value of first parameter to zero and second parameter to '/'.
      NotSupportedOperationException - This is exception thrown in case that programmer sets value of second parameter to anything else but '+', '-', '*' or '/'.
      See Also:
      DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException
